welcome.title: Welcome to PulzWaveArtNetMidiBridge
welcome.subtitle: Let's get you set up in just a few steps
welcome.description: This app converts Art-Net DMX signals to MIDI, allowing you to synchronize your lighting console with MIDI-compatible software. This tool is mainly created towards Pangolin Quickshow, but might work for other software as well.

dmx.title: DMX Configuration
dmx.subtitle: Step 1 of 3
dmx.description: Configure which Art-Net universe and DMX channel range PulzWaveArtNetMidiBridge should listen to.
dmx.universe_help: Select Universe 1 or 2 to match your SoundSwitch Art-Net output settings.
dmx.channel_help: The first DMX channel of the 9-channel block that PulzWaveArtNetMidiBridge will read. Channels are: R, G, B, W, UV, Intensity, Strobe, Attribute, Hold.

midi.title: MIDI Output
midi.subtitle: Step 2 of 3
midi.description: Select the MIDI output device where PulzWaveArtNetMidiBridge will send control signals.
midi.port_help: Choose a virtual MIDI port (like loopMIDI on Windows or IAC Driver on macOS) or a physical MIDI interface.
midi.no_ports_warning: No MIDI ports detected. Please install a virtual MIDI driver like loopMIDI (Windows) or enable IAC Driver (macOS).
midi.intensity_help: The minimum MIDI intensity value (0-127) that will be sent even when the intensity is at zero. Useful to keep visuals slightly visible.

connection.title: Connection Test
connection.subtitle: Step 3 of 3
connection.description: Let's verify that PulzWaveArtNetMidiBridge can receive Art-Net data from SoundSwitch.
connection.waiting_description: Please start SoundSwitch now, if it is not already running. Make sure Art-Net output is enabled in SoundSwitch settings.
connection.success_description: PulzWaveArtNetMidiBridge is successfully receiving DMX data. You're all set!
connection.skip_text: Skip this test and finish setup

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting Tips
tips: In SoundSwitch: Settings → Art-Net → Enable Art-Net output
Verify the universe number matches your SoundSwitch Art-Net settings
Ensure SoundSwitch and PulzWaveArtNetMidiBridge are on the same computer or network
Some firewalls may block UDP port 6454 - try disabling temporarily

tooltips.universe: Art-Net universes range from 0-15. Each universe carries 512 DMX channels.
tooltips.start_channel: PulzWaveArtNetMidiBridge uses 9 consecutive channels starting from this number.
tooltips.midi_port: Virtual MIDI ports allow routing MIDI between applications on the same computer.
tooltips.min_intensity: Set higher than 0 if you want visuals to always have a base brightness.
